Here are some safety tips for construction workers:

*   Participate in ongoing training to stay up-to-date on safety practices and proper handling of tools and machinery.
*   Use proper lifting techniques to minimize the risk of injury.
*   Always use safety equipment like safety helmets, hard hats, protective eyewear, and gloves.
*   Wear clothing or vests in bright colors to increase visibility.
*   Report safety concerns.
*   Follow the 20-20-20 rule to identify hazards.
*   Maintain clean and organized work areas.

sources.title: 10 Critical Safety Tips for Construction Work
sources.content: Ongoing training keeps construction workers up to date on the latest safety practices and reiterates the importance of construction site safety. Improperly handled tools and heavy machinery are a common cause of accidents, so it's critical that workers are trained on the proper handling and operation of all construction site gear. Construction workers should also be trained on the proper lifting techniques when carrying supplies and materials on a construction site to minimize the risk of back injury and other ailments. Unfortunately, falls are a common type of construction site accident—yet almost all falls can be prevented with the proper safety measures in place. Workers should always be encouraged to report safety concerns at any time during a construction project. Many construction sites have "concern boxes" or a similar system in place where workers can submit safety concerns anonymously. By following the construction safety tips outlined above, workers can protect themselves from common construction site hazards while maintaining safer worksites overall.
